meanings.sent1: The pretrimmed bushes looked neat and tidy in the garden.
meanings.sent2: She bought a pretrimmed Christmas tree to save time decorating.
meanings.sent3: The pretrimmed hedges were so perfectly shaped, they almost seemed artificial.
meanings.sent4: Her pretrimmed hair framed her face like a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The pretrimmed lawn was like a green carpet welcoming guests.

meanings.definition: Having been cut or shaped beforehand
meanings.sent1: The pretrimmed fabric made sewing the dress much easier.
meanings.sent2: The pretrimmed vegetables made cooking dinner a breeze.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his pretrimmed beard made him look like a movie star.
meanings.sent4: The pretrimmed paper fit perfectly into the frame, like a puzzle piece.
meanings.sent5: The pretrimmed wood was ready to be assembled into a beautiful bookshelf.

meanings.definition: Prepared by removing excess material before use
meanings.sent1: The pretrimmed leather was ready to be crafted into a new wallet.
meanings.sent2: She appreciated the pretrimmed nails that saved her time at the salon.
meanings.sent3: The pretrimmed cake slices were so perfectly even, it was satisfying to look at.
meanings.sent4: The pretrimmed fabric felt smooth and luxurious against her skin.
meanings.sent5: The pretrimmed vegetables made cooking a delicious stir-fry quick and easy.
